boardgame.name: Stinky Business
boardgame.description:
Stinky Business is a family game for two to five players of age 10 and up. The goal of the game is to build the most successful waste processing company, that will bring the highest income and the most victory points.

The players incorporate the roles of waste processing managers who will build recycling and incineration plants, as well as waste processing facilities in order to transform unwanted waste into profitable business.

The game lasts ten rounds, each divided into four phases. In the first littering phase players draw four waste cards each from the draw pile and choose exactly one of them to keep. Later on comes the investment phase in which players may purchase recycling and incineration plants as well as the waste processing facility and profitability tokens, that will be placed at the players boards. All those investments influence the recycling and incineration phase, which provides players with waste cards, that will be processed in the last phase in order to bring revenue.

After the last, 10th round the game finishes and the time comes for assessment of the players efforts. Victory points are awarded for proper investments and gained money. The players may also be punished with negative points for garbage cards and waste cards that they discarded during the game. After summing up the victory and negative points, the winner is determined.

Waste processing has never been this much fun!

boardgame.name: Frankenstein Atomic Frontier Revised Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stitches! Monsters! Cowboys!

The one, the only, the infamous, the monstrous FRANKENSTEIN ATOMIC FRONTIER; the Patchwork Post-Apocalyptic Western now resurrected in its Revised Edition! Welcome to the savage tomorrow of the Sublime, a wild landscape where the cutting edges of yesterday’s science have bred tomorrows horrors. Here in this untamed tomorrow Humanity is extinct and Frankenstein monster’s hold the last lights of civilization.

Presenting the same streamlined, rules light system post-atomic weirdly surgical world in a bigger and more grotesque format than before, the Revised Edition only fixes what was broken, adding more along the way... Added background, more Special Parts, extra Gear, additional Bad Guys, new art, and most of all: clarified and expanded rules. Not to mention the improved character sheet. If this is your first trip to the Sublime, the Revised Edition is the perfect place to start. For the wasteland veteran, no existing content is voided, only clarified and expanded.

Just like the original, the revised edition of Frankenstein Atomic Frontier boasts:

Flexible setting.
Easy to learn rules system.
Evocative mechanics to generate the “feel” of being a Frankenstein creation.
Card based mechanics that are entirely dice free.
Fast character creation.
100% Australian made!


The Revised Edition contributes:

Substantial new background materials.
Detail of the post-apocalyptic landscape of the Sublime.
More Special Parts and Rare Cuts.
Expanded Grafting rules to make even more monstrous creations.
New artwork.
A huge array of Bad Guys.
Tips on Game Mastering Frankenstein Atomic Frontier.
Revised Character sheet.


So what are you waiting for, Pilgrim? Tighten those stitches and saddle up!

boardgame.name: The Demon Stones (Pathfinder)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When huge stones fall out of the night sky,
A deadly curse settles over Gravencross.
Help the village exorcise the Demon Stones.

“The sun had set an hour ago, and the rain lashed down and the wind howled on the dark moor. A storm this late in the season was unusual, but this one seemed different. The clouds were more menacing, tinged with anger, the rain colder and more biting than usual.

Skerrill had to find the lost calf and get him back to the farm before his father came back from the city on business. He’d been looking for two hours now, and he was right in the middle of the moor when the storm hit. He knew he should have turned back as soon as darkness fell, but then he was never the brightest boy in the valley. If only he had remembered to lock the farm gate.

The calf was now likely dead anyway having stumbled among the boulders and rocks panicking in the dark, and then fallen in a floodwater stream and drowned. Either way, he was in more trouble than he could imagine.

Suddenly, a bright flash of white light and a roaring peal of thunder were preceded by an explosion as a huge object fell from the sky and impacted the ground of the moor no more than a stone’s throw from him. Dirt, mud, water, and debris erupted from the impact site, flying high into the air and then covering the moor for hundreds of feet all around.

Skerrill was knocked to the ground instantly and covered in the fallout from the blast. His ears rang and his head spun, but he staggered to his feet in a daze.

He stumbled to where the blast had happened only moments before, and in a depression in the ground lay a huge stone glowing orange as if hot. Skerrill passed out.

Two more thunderous explosions crashed in the distance.”

An adventure compatible with The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game for APL5.
The adventure takes place in an area called the Hoarwych Valley, which can fit into any campaign.
The small village of Gravencross is richly detailed and works as a standalone base for adventuring in any campaign.
Could be converted to other systems with relative ease.
79 pages, consisting of:
62 pages of adventure, art, maps, important characters, and, monsters,
4 pages of OGL/licensing information,
2 pages of 25mm scale simple cut-out counters for tabletop use,
7 pages of scan-able player maps for VTT use,
3 blank lined pages for adventure notes.
1 Publisher logo page.

New monsters: Ostopheles, lesser basalt elementals, and fyrs,
New god: Basaltor

boardgame.name: Missing Mythic Magic Volume XVII
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uncover Forgotten Arcane Lore!

Everyone knows that knowledge is power, and that having options is better than not having them. It should come as no surprise, then, that wizards, witches, and other powerful spellcasters are always on the lookout for new and exciting spells to add to their repertoires. While many spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook received a facelift and an upgrade in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Mythic Adventures, the sourcebook that introduced mythic power to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, dozens of spells were left behind. Missing Mythic Magic Volume XVII, and its predecessors, aim to give each and every spell from the core rules a full-fledged mythic upgrade, all the way from A to Z, with a special focus on making mythic spells that feel as over-the-top and larger-than-life as possible.

This installment includes 20 mythic spells, from remove disease to scrying, greater. A mythic repel metal or stone can affect objects of much greater size, and grants much greater control over how they are repelled, including allowing you to make ranged attacks with them. A mythic resilient sphere can be created so that it is not anchored in place, allowing you to roll it about freely, and is much more resistant to damage. A mythic resurrection can not only bring back outsiders, constructs, and undead, it can even bring back those whose souls are unwilling or imprisoned, and a mythic rusting grasp can affect a much wider array of objects, and can even take the form of a 60-ft.-radius burst. This tome contains all that, and much, much more!

boardgame.name: Return of the Mad Hermit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Only the bravest adventurers dare to enter Abbottsfolly Wood. The local villagers at the nearby keep tell of a crazed wizard who once dwelt there. Legends say the wizard could travel beyond the world of men, into the darkest reaches of the hidden worlds. Some say his evil magic lingers on and that the very trees whisper warnings on the night breeze. Can you find the wizard's lair and unlock his dark secrets or will you succumb to the power of the Master of Many Worlds?

Return of the Mad Hermit is a short Swords and Wizardry WhiteBox adventure designed for 3-6 characters of 1st-3rd levels (about 12 levels total), but is suitable for any OSR game. Return of the Mad Hermit is a dimension-hopping romp that contains a mixture of problem solving and dungeon crawling elements. A wide range of monsters and challenges are involved, so a variety of classes is recommended. The adventure can be "dropped in" to any outdoor wilderness setting whenever the characters make camp for the night.

ADVENTURE BACKGROUND
In ages past, an adventuring wizard named Faloren of Marks roamed the land, fighting evil alongside holy warriors of the Church of Law and Order. Faloren became obsessed with the concept of other planes of existence and devoted his life to exploring the mysteries of the universe. He eventually retired with enough wealth to build a remote wizard's tower on the borderlands and continue his research. In time, he discovered how to open mystical doorways that allowed him to explore entirely new worlds.

To the villagers at the nearby keep, it seemed that the strange wizard had chosen to become a hermit. Before long, folk grew uneasy and began to whisper. After a number of bad omens, failed crops, and strange disappearances, the villagers were certain that Faloren had been tainted by the evil he had once fought. They convinced a band of adventurers known as the Brighton Swords to bring the "dark wizard" Faloren to justice.

The Brighton Swords stormed the tower and a terrible battle was fought. The tower was razed, but the adventurers were slain. Faloren barely survived the encounter and fled deeper into the borderland forest where he hid in the bole of a hollowed oak tree. The villagers at the keep assumed he had been killed in the battle.

In time, Faloren resumed his research into planar travel and eventually opened doorways into small "pocket dimensions" of his own design. However, Faloren lacked the proper ingredients and resources to safely travel between worlds and with each crossing, his mind slowly became unhinged.

Faloren was recognized one day by a huntsman, and word spread among the nearby settlements that he still lived. The local priest led soldiers and a mob of able-bodied men into the woods in search of him. Faloren chose not to kill the misguided soldiers. Instead, he used an ancient spell to shift their life's essence into a thick stand of trees, and this forest later became known as Abbotsfolly Wood.

Paranoid and fearful that stronger enemies might come looking for him, Faloren poured his own life's essence into six brass chimes and hid them among his pocket dimensions. Faloren's madness continued to grow and he eventually lost all knowledge of magic. He became a sneak thief and mad hermit who roamed the countryside with various animal companions and preyed upon travelers. Legends say that Faloren was killed by a band of wandering adventurers and that afterwards, the local faeries took pity on him and laid his bones to rest inside the hollowed oak.

Countless years have past, and Faloren's spell has slowly begun to unravel. A lightning strike recently killed one of the enspelled trees, and one of its largest limbs fell to the ground, just waiting to be picked up by a band of weary adventurers. . .

boardgame.name: Swamp Dungeon of the Bandit Lord
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Swamp Dungeon of the Bandit Lord is a short Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox adventure designed for 3-6 characters of 1st through 3rd level (about 12 levels total). The adventure involves exploration of a dungeon that has been magically transformed into a swampy cave complex. The characters can expect to encounter a wide range of monsters and challenges, so a variety of classes is recommended.

Note: This adventure takes place in Willow Valley, a fantasy sandbox that is fully detailed in the WhiteBox Omnibus published by Barrel Rider Games. Willow Valley is centered around Willow Lake and is home to humans, elves, dwarves, halflings, and other fantasy races. The valley setting can be easily adapted to any fantasy campaign world.

ADVENTURE BACKGROUND
In dark times past, after the great dragon Agathareon fell to the arch-mage Asagrim the Abjurer, the beleaguered folk of Willow Valley were plagued by bandits and raiders. One of the most wicked was the bandit lord Kaven Redblood whose stronghold of Redblood Keep stood atop Tallrock Hill, allowing him to prey on travelers along the Citadel Road.

Kaven's ambition was to crown himself King of Willow Valley, but he knew that the people would eventually rally against him. Therefore, he ventured deep into the Swamps of Sithiss to seek an alliance with the lizardmen tribes who dwelt there. The Sithissian shaman gave Kaven the seed of a sacred cypress tree known as the Heart of Sithiss. The shaman told Kaven that once the seed was planted and nurtured, the lizardmen would honor him as a brother and the very Swamps of Sithiss would come to his aid in times of need.

Kaven's return to Redblood Keep did not go unnoticed by the free folk of Willow Valley. An alliance of Willowford militia, Burrowmoor halflings, and Citadel dwarves laid siege to his stronghold and reduced it to rubble, forcing him to take refuge in the dungeons below.

In desperation, Kaven planted the magical cypress seed in a deep dank cave, hoping its magic would conjure up a Sithissian army to fall upon his enemies. Unfortunately for him, the Sithissians had no intention of honoring their bargain. The seed was cursed with a magic that was designed to transform the very earth into swampland. The moment it was planted, it sucked the life from Kaven and his followers and used this energy to magically transform the caves of Tallrock Dungeon.

Unable to gain access to the dungeons, and having seen no sign of Kaven or his followers for weeks, the Willow Valley alliance grudgingly returned to their homes. Time passed, new threats arose and were vanquished, and the siege of Redblood Keep eventually became a distant memory known only to a few.

Cut off from the world outside, the denizens of Tallrock Dungeon slipped into a magical slumber. But all the while, the magical cypress continued to grow beneath the earth, its magic building as it waited to be unleashed.

Recently, a group of dwarven miners from Stoneaxe Citadel came upon a hidden staircase and a secret entrance into the dungeons of Tallrock Hill. As soon as they opened the door, the tree's magic burst forth upon the land, draining the life force of the dwarven miners and using their energy to revive the swamp creatures who dwelt within its dungeon home. Now, this magic has begun to spread. . .

boardgame.name: Micropend6
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Micropend6 is the fastest and easiest way to learn and play the OpenD6 system. It takes the game made famous by West End Games' Star Wars RPG and distills it down into a concise and concentrated document. Even at only 2,500 words, Micropend6 is a complete game and system toolkit for OpenD6.

What's different from other OpenD6 games?

Complete but compact (only 2,500 words or 13 pages)
Streamlined rules and language that keep all of the OpenD6 fun without the bloat
Three Attributes
Six default Skills and rules how to fill out the Skill List
New Drives mechanic motivates characters and adds a basis for Character Points (CP)
Simplified and codified combat rules
Hero Point Bowl rules for shared Hero Points
No GM rolling


Micropend6 takes a few minutes to read and set up, perfect for experienced D6 gamers who want a quick refresher on the basics of the system, or for new people who've never played OpenD6 or its precedecessors.

boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

After three decades of preparation, the evil troll Grimtooth has finally thrown wide the gates of his abode to all comers. The troll has sent ravens far and wide inviting delvers to share in the vast wealth of his treasure room. Of course, there is a catch. The adventurers must wend their way through a maze of traps in Grimtooth’s Museum of Death, a curated collection of the deadliest and most devious traps ever assembled in one place. Along the way, they might even cross paths with a few of Grimtooth’s allies: Grimtina, Spike the Grimdog, and Sludgeworth. Tread lightly, delver. There are no refunds for this tour.


From the introduction:

After three decades, the wait is nearly over. In Grimtooth’s Museum of Death, you and your players finally get the chance to delve into the evil troll’s base of operations first detailed in the pages of Grimtooth’s Trap Comics. Deadly traps old and new are waiting to be sprung, from Castle Grimtooth down to the lower treasure levels. You just might see a few familiar faces on your journey, too.

boardgame.name: Die Box
boardgame.description:
Without huge rulesbook, without masses of material, without lots of fuss.
The different games in this box are small, easy to learn and you may play them everywhere.
There´s something in the box for everybody – for strategic thinkers, for optimizers, for bluffers, for memory-cracks….

Nußknacker – Nutcracker
For 3-4 players
What shows the hidden card? Ask smart and listen how the nut cracks.
Not a game for people with brains like bricks#

16 cards with the values of 1 to 8. One card is placed face down - the aim is, to identify this card) The active player asks another player about a value between 1 and 8 (a game with all 16 cards (2x8) is quite complex...). The value has to be on his hand either as single card or as sum. The others answers either with "No" (no card/s with this value on my hand) or with the value in one or more cards. The other players just see the number of exchange cards, not their values.
I.e. if one askes about a 6 and passes one card, is HAS to be the Six. If the other player passes two cards it might be 3/3, 4/2 or 5/1.
Whoever indentifies the face down card correctly, wins.

Bauab – Buildown
For 2 players
It´s a rough play amongst the building contractors. Save building sites for you, plan buildings, kick the others and force them to retreat.

Sorry, Folks, but this here is too complex, to explain it some sentences. Two players try to save construction areas for their own buildings, by placing planning-chips or reservation-chips on a variable board. Every player tries to take the last free area of his opponents chips - reminds me a bit on Go..., but of course, the game is faster and the value of the chips is important too.

Raufer – Upper
For 3-4 players
Chase the others through the staircases and take their opportunities to move. But take care that you are not sticked by yourself…

20 cards with values of 1 to 20. Quite easy card game. The active player plays a card and commends to the next "up" or "down", which means to react with a higher or lower value. If possible, the player gives the next command to his neighbour. If not, he has to take an additional card. Bad luck, if nobody can react properly - than the first player has to take additional cards. So, recall all played cards.
Winner is the player, who played his last card.

Misd
3-8 Players
Which symbol is missing? Is it missed really? A game for fast thinkers.
Kids will blame you…

Everything planned?!
For 3-4 players
Is there a plan? Change places? Change Cards? Plan the use of your cards?
Who plans with lack of plans, wins.

Schollenschubser – Floe pushers
For 2-4 players
Be the first to cross the icy sea over swaying floes to safety. Charity begins at home. Shurely not a game for the kindhearted…

Schlauraff – Smartsnatch
For 2-4 players
Use your dice perfectly and get the uppermost points. More than simple but never the same

Just a remark: since the producer delievered us... eh... somewhat insufficient dice (from our point of view...) we ordered better dice, and pass them with every sold box.

And another remark: authors of the games in this box are: Till Meyer, Klaus-Peter Rudolph and H.&W. Fuhr

And another one: there only one language-based game in the box, but for this and all other games we offer an english rulesbook as download. It may need some time, since Christian enjoys his holidays and we want to present you grafics too - not just plain text. :-)

boardgame.name: Love Season
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Love Season is a card game about Little bunnies' love affairs.

In this game of chase you are a little bunny trying to go home but bunny girls find you so cute they won't let you go away.
For 3 to 6 players from 8 years old and up (works best with adults and teenagers ;) ), this game can take less than 20 min to play. It can go faster once you know it well and can end up in 5 min.

The rules :
Cards are divided in two categories. The one you can play during your turn for scoring, and the one you can play every time to any players, the bunny girls (attack) and the defensive cards to escape.

The first that reach 7 jump cards and reach a rabbit hole card win. But, while you jumping around, other player can send you bunnies that catch you and block your progression.

boardgame.name: Samrat: Rise of The Delhi Sultanate
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's website:

Samrat is a board game that takes you back to 12th - 13th century medieval India. This is the time when Muhammad Ghori unravels his plans to take over India. India was ruled by Prithviraj Chauhan from Delhi and Raja Jaichand from Kannauj in the current state of Uttar Pradesh. To the west, Gujarat was under the rule of Raja Bhimdev II. While history notes the success story of how Muhammad Ghori defeats these kings, Samrat gives the players another chance to rewrite history.

Each player takes on the role of a king from medieval India and completes his objectives to earn stars. Some of these are based on true Indian history! Players build camps in their kingdoms to produce three types of resources - Gold, Stone and Wood. Use resources to raise an army and complete the identified objectives. The first player to earn five stars (2 players) or seven stars (3 or 4 players) wins the game.

boardgame.name: The Sorceress of Zoom: Down to Earth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The Earth Plane Vexes Me! I Will Stand For It No Longer!"

The Sorceress of Zoom is the most powerful spellcaster on her homeworld. There are few sights that terrify populations more than her amazing cloud city appearing in the air above their homes -- for the sorceress is never denied what she wants, and others always pay the price. She is the deadliest of femme fatales, and she is turning her attention to the treasures of Earth!

The Sorceress of Zoom was a quirky fantasy series that appeared in the pages of Weird Comics during 1940 and 1941. Featuring the weirdest of weird fantasy, each installment saw her bringing to bear powerful magic to ward off all comers in pursuit of selfish and often horrific goals. It's a great example of the "anything goes" nature of the early Golden Age of Comics.

In addition to five classic tales of the Sorceress, The Sorceress of Zoom: Down to Earth contains feats, a talent tree, and other rules to bring Sorceress-style reality-style action to your OGL d20 System games; as well as game stats for the artifacts that grant their possessor mastery of Zoom, the Sorceress's flying city.

boardgame.name: Drake Mining and Manufacturing
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Argo Galaxy is growing – not physically but figuratively. After years of study, the House of the Alliance has finally decided to open the Hastilion Expanse for full settlement and corporate utilization. Researchers identified numerous planets and moons as optimal for civilization and corporations from around the known galaxy, including Drake Mining and Manufacturing, are making plans to acquire land.

Since its inception, Drake Mining and Manufacturing has prided itself on mining resources and creating high-quality products from those resources to support the entire galaxy. Moving into the Hastilion Expanse provides them with a wealth of opportunities to expand their operations and grow their business. That is, of course, if their new facilities can survive.

New planets are always fraught with hidden dangers from native flora and fauna, pirates, rival corporations, and rebellious populations. Only the strength of Drake’s mercenary force will help them overcome any roadblocks and become successful. As long as they don’t get killed in the process.

Draking Mining and Manufacturing presents the primer of the Hastilion Expanse campaign for Mercenary Breed Savage Worlds or can be used as a standalone setting for new adventures and campaigns. Originally published in Savage Insider Premium and the Hastilion Expanse Compendiums, this new campaign setting updates the content to Mercenary Breed 2.0 and expands on the original content.

Drake Mining and Manufacturing includes:

An introduction to the Hastilion Expanse campaign.
A look at Drake Mining and Manufacturing
3 new character xeno templates.
A gazetteer of the Hastilion Expanse with 9 descriptive planets.
Mechanics for housing and vehicles pertaining to the campaign.

boardgame.name: Exiles of the Wicked Maze
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Exiles Of The Wicked Maze, a complete traditional tabletop game for 1 player! This game is a sword and sorcery style quest in which you play a prisoner exiled to a massive labyrinth located below the vast, wicked city that you once called home. The basic rules are simple enough. Start at the entrance of the maze and work your way through to the ending point, collecting enough treasure to pay a fine of 5,000 coins as you go. Along the way you will encounter a variety of different symbols, most of these will require you to make a random roll on a chart or two. Some of these symbols will allow you to gain treasure, while others may require you to avoid a deadly trap or fight a monster. Your gained treasures and suffered wounds are recorded on a simple character sheet, which in some ways is similar to the character sheets that you would expect to find with a typical table top role playing game.

Unlike a typical table top role playing game, no “game master” is required. The encountered symbols and random roll charts dictate the challenges and treasures that you stumble upon. Unlike a typical table top board game, you draw your way through freshly printed copy of the maze rather than rolling dice and moving an equal number of spaces.

boardgame.name: Ek: 3 small expansions
boardgame.description:
Temple of the Moon (N)
Use the large tile with the Temple of the Moon on it (N) during setup to replace the large tile that is basically identical to it (E).
The Temple of the Moon space is a construction space equivalent to a Reg.

If you have a building on the Temple of the Moon, then during your Reinforcement phase, you can destroy two discs from your reserve (put them in the box) to place a solitary disc in reinforcement, wherever you like on the board, ignoring the usual reinforcement rules. That is to say that you can place this disc by itself on an empty space and/or on a space adjacent to an enemy building, and/or on a tempest space.

The Emperor cannot be sacrificed to use the Temple of the Moon.

Temple of the Sand (O)

Use the large tile with the Temple of the Sand on it (O) during setup to replace the large tile that is basically identical to it (B).
The Temple of the Sand space is a construction space equivalent to a Reg.

If you have a building on the Temple of the Sand, then one time during your turn, before your Action phase, you can destroy two discs from your reserve (put them in the box) to return an enemy disc (other than an Emperor) from the board to its owner’s reserve.

The Emperor cannot be sacrificed to use the Temple of the Sand.

The Beacon of Eon (U)
The Beacon of Eon tile (U) is intended to be used with the variants that use Tempest tiles. During the setup, add the Beacon of Eon tile wherever you like.

The Beacon of Eon tile is a Tempest tile (see base game rules, page 6).

Whoever occupies the most of the spaces around the Beacon of Eon ignores the rules for Tempest tiles (in the event of a tie, no player benefits from this effect). This player therefore treats Tempest spaces like normal spaces: She does not lose a disc by moving into or through them, and can reinforce her stacks there.

BEDLAM™ is a thrilling post-apocalyptic single-player roguelike strategy game, created for the PC utilizing ‘The Banner Saga’ engine.

The player is cast as the mysterious Mechanic, the last known member of a once-thriving guild of intrepid travelers and brilliant inventors. As the Mechanic, you are in charge of commanding your crew in battles, managing your resources, improving your Dozer, interacting with various characters, and protecting your passengers while navigating through the post-apocalyptic land of Bedlam.

Remember – One chance and one crew to make it through!
Think you have what it takes? Then grab the controls, equip your Dozer, load your passengers, assemble your diverse battle-ready crew and prepare for your journey to a new destination on the far edge of Bedlam!

Your goal is to travel from the futuristic metropolis of Bysantine through the chaotic realm of Bedlam to reach the rumored utopia of Aztec City with as many of your passengers and crew intact as possible.

But here is the challenge: with no game saves, you get one chance and one crew to make it! The game is designed for single-session playthroughs, with randomly generated encounters and discoveries to ensure a new experience each time you play!

The path through Bedlam is filled with peril and uncertainty, with numerous obstacles you must prevail to complete the journey. Your reputation and reward depend on the majority of your passengers surviving, so make every action and decision count!

The combat in BEDLAM is turn-based and incorporates our exciting blitz battle system, which has three main features: no turn-order for combatants, powerful Dozer upgrades (various abilities your crew can use on the battlefield), and a primary Dozer weapon that can turn the tide of a battle in an instant!

During battle there is no turn-order among your crew members, allowing you to select anyone on the battle board to move and/or attack each round. Combat plays like carnage-filled chess, with different classes (melee, shotgun, pistol and rifle) that each have a specific movement distance and optimal damage range.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Crazy Cat Lady
boardgame.description:
In Crazy Cat Lady players must fill the void in their life and cross the threshold into becoming a Crazy Cat Lady! While trying to acquire cats players must balance a job, renovate their home, and deal with general cat maintenance.

The entire game is represented by a deck of 36 cards. Using three smaller decks from these cards, players draw cards using a set amount of points each turn, based on their current job. By acquiring and playing these cards you can advance your career and gain more points per turn, renovate your home to house more cats, and of course acquire more cats as well. The forth deck however causes you to draw an event that adds common cat complications to your life. Plays in 5 minutes (or less).

New Print-And-Play Available Now as of May 7th, 2017 featuring art by Kyle Ferrin!

If you like the game you can purchase a professionally printed copy at the following web address: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/crazy-cat-lady

boardgame.name: Engineering Ants
boardgame.description:
Engineering Ants is a cooperative game for 2–4 players. The players take turns rolling a die to move the shared engineering ant token around the board in search of blocked ants. Upon finding a blocked ant, the players work together to build something that will help the blocked ant get around the obstacle. The games includes 12 tubes (4 tall, 8 short), 8 clips, 8 connectors, 8 caps, and an assortments of cardboard pieces giving you wings, propellers, ladders, etc. If the players free all three blocked ants before the anteater token (which moves on certain die rolls and based on the engineering ant landing on certain spots on the board) arrives at the central anthill, then the players win.

From the box:

A creative cooperative building game for 2–4 players, aged 5+.

Beat the Obstacle and Rescue the Ants!

Use your creativity to build solutions to help free the ants.

But watch out! The Anteater is on his way to the anthill! If you can free all of the ants and get them back to the anthill before the Anteater gets there, you all win as a team! Engineering Ants is a game that inspires kids to invent, design and build.

boardgame.name: Hong
boardgame.description:
Hong, named after a two-headed dragon in Chinese mythology, is a tile-laying game of asymmetrical goals for two players.

In a mystic land far away an empire is attacked by a fearless dragon master who is trying to conquer the empire by sending two headed dragons (Hongs) to defeat the emperor. As long as the dragons don’t come in big numbers the emperor will be able defend it, but the dragon master knows that a lot of small dragons can be the doom of the empire.
Can the emperor save his land or will the dragon master flood the empire with dragons?

This edition of Hong from White Goblin Games keeps the gameplay of the original design while including a double-sided game board (Castle and Garden), a mini-expansion (Lair of the Seven Great Dragons), and all-new artwork.

boardgame.name: Earth Tongue
Earthtongue
boardgame.description:
A sunless world of fungi and bugs, sustained by a slow rain of nutritious substance, could use your guidance and cataloging.

EarthTongue is a vivarium sim that places in you limited control over a small ecosystem on a fantastical world. You will spend most of your time watching life grow and eat each other to survive. Your subtle nudges will be required to maintain the balance of this world, but it can handle itself much of the time. Player given goals are limited, aside from maximizing the health of your ecosystem. You may choose to try to create a fungal garden to your liking. You may try your best to breed as many beetles as you can. You might use those beetles instead as food stock for the mantises. You might instead just peacefully watch the story of Earthtongue unfold on its own.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Gran Hotel Austria
Grand Austria Hotel
boardgame.description:
In the thick of the Viennese modern age, exquisite cafés are competing for customers. Inspiring artists, important politicians, and tourists from all over the world are populating Vienna and in need of a hotel room. This is your opportunity to turn your little café into a world famous hotel. Hire staff, fulfill the wishes of your guests, and gain the emperor's favor. Only then will your café become the Grand Austria Hotel.

The start player rolls the dice, sorting them by the rolled number and placing them on the corresponding action spaces. On a turn, a player chooses one of the six actions and carries it out. The number of the available dice in the corresponding action spaces determines how much the player gets from the action. They then remove one of the dice and can carry out additional actions. With the different actions, a player can get the necessary drinks and dishes, prepare the rooms, or hire staff.

But no hotel can grow without guests. To choose wisely which guests to attract and to complete their orders brings some important bonus actions. The staff cards also have different advantages, but the game ends after seven rounds and no player can do everything they want, so whoever makes the right decisions and finds the best way to create bonus actions will win.

With 116 different cards and a new set-up in each game, Grand Austria Hotel provides a huge replay value. Each game stands on its own and demands new tactics and strategies.

boardgame.name: Hengist
boardgame.description:
Thirty years have passed since the Romans left Britain. The power of the Picts and the Scots is growing, and they are pushing inland. In order to save Britain, the great chieftain Vortigern has asked the Saxon brothers Hengist and Horsa to help defend Britain. You and your brother agree to help, but over the years Vortigern has become greedy and does not pay you enough.

It is time for you to take matters into your own hands and take what is rightfully yours! You have good maps, strong fighters, and stout boats. The coast is littered with villages, towns, monasteries, and estates. All are waiting to be pillaged! Who will win the thrilling hunt for fame and fortune: Hengist or Horsa?

In Hengist, both players compete for the same treasure tiles. The player who reaches a treasure tile with one of his raiding groups first gets the tile — but a part of the road is hidden and must be explored first. Not always is the direct path the most successful way. The player who uses their cards wisely and has a little bit of luck will get the more valuable treasure tiles and win the game.

boardgame.name: Ocracoke: Gold and Glory
boardgame.description:
Legend had it that Ocracoke Island was a haven for pirates and a most mysterious hideout for Blackbeard. To celebrate the harvest of the last plunder, he held a huge party for pirates from across all oceans. Unfortunately, while everyone was present enjoying the party, an explosion interrupted the festivities. The navy had discovered their hideout! Every guest ran for their lives, but biggest treasure was still on Blackbeard's ship, Queen Anne's Revenge. Blackbeard and his men had no choice, but to defend their ship from being captured by the navy!

In Ocracoke: Gold and Glory, if you are the navy, you fight for the glory of the country, trying to collect enough treasure that you can place Blackbeard in jail. Otherwise, you collect as many gold coins as you can, then run away from the turmoil. In game terms, you want to collect five coins before anyone else, and you do this by taking actions:


Use the ability of one of two double-sided action cards, then flip the card to its other side.
Declare the answer with all players.


Players continue for several rounds until one player collects their fifth coin, at which point the game ends immediately.

boardgame.name: Pugmire Gen Con Brochure
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover:

Pugmire is one of the first of Onyx Path Publishing's creator-owned games, produced in a partnership with veteran game designer Eddy Webb and his company, Pugsteady. It's also part of the Open Development program featured on the Onyx Path website; you can follow Eddy's posts for updates about this new game.

Some highlights of Pugmire include:

Family-friendly world inspired by comics, novels, films, and games such as Mouse Guard, Redwall, and early Dungeons & Dragons releases like the Expedition to the Barrier Peaks.
Traditional fantasy rules system redesigned for quick creation of heroic characters and streamlined game play, with an emphasis on cooperation and action over competition and violence.
A variety of callings and breeds that give focus to a character's role in society and in the adventuring party.
Rival races, like cats and badgers, along with terrifying and dangerous monsters that roam the landscape.
Iconic characters, like Princess Yosha Pug, and setting hooks to frame the mystery of this world.


Will YOU be a good dog?

boardgame.name: Who's Boss. Animal Riots: The CARD GAME
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Who's Boss. Animal Riots is a gang battling game for wannabe gang bosses, Rioters and control freaks who love to beat the socks off..midnight roaming shombies, terrifying sheeponators, intimidating bully-builders, a One ton crusher Hippo Butt, lamb chop LORDS who love their steak RAW ants with nanchaku skills gone nuts ,..and many many more wacky characters ready to defend their territory no matter what!!

To win this highly strategic animal powered card game, first you’ll be forced to become a mob boss!!
A number card is placed on the table facing up. Based on the hand of cards, you must play your positively and negatively numbered cards in an increasing or decreasing sequence, kicking your rivals butt through wicked strategies and tactics, leading your blood thirsty crew to victory.

You must try to get rid of your cards by deploying ATTACK cards, COUNTER-ATTACK and REVOKE cards, cards that allow you to predict the next players move, SKIP and FORCE cards and many more!!

To win this highly strategic game, you must decide which cards to play, when to play them and which of your rival Bosses to target.
The game is kids friendly, lots of fun and easy to play.

boardgame.name: Stranded No More: The Mutiny
boardgame.description:
The prequel to Stranded No More, SNM: The Mutiny, is a solitaire game where you lead a crew through a series of missions as Captain Oscar Locke. Years of “poor treatment” has caused the rumblings of a mutiny among the crew aboard The Scream of Atlantis. There is no agreement of who should usurp the Captain but some pirates are angrier than others. As the Captain, you’ll need to balance the anger each of your crew members has while also keeping the mutiny meter below the combustion line. If you can successfully complete all of the missions while keeping your crew happy, will avoid a mutiny and won’t get stranded.

The goal of the game is twofold: get through the chosen missions while avoiding a mutiny and to accumulate the most amount of gold possible. To do the former it’ll likely come at the detriment of the latter. Your ability to manage the levels of anger and mutiny while pressing your luck will determine your success as a Pirate Captain.

boardgame.name: Valentin Krupova
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games! The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

At the end of this document is a sheet of character and spell tokens including a token for this character and assorted Non-Player Characters (NPCs) and spell effects. For best results, print the token page and laminate the entire sheet. Initially cut out into squares. To improve ability to move and pick up the laminated tokens, trim off the gray corners to make an octagonal shape.

Snapshot Statement

Valentin is a lawful good male halfling with paladin levels using the empyreal knight archetype who specializes in ranged combat and making use of his canine mount in small spaces.

boardgame.name: Caveat Emptor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So your PCs have gone to the market to pick up some last minute things for their next adventure... Rope, a few extra arrows, some trail rations, and an 11-foot pole when a 10-foot one simply won't do. You could simply say "Ok, that'll be 4 gold, 2 silver, and 3 copper, don't forget to mark them off your character sheet." Or you could offer a richer environment for roleplaying with a marketplace to explore. Imagine haggling with the store clerk over that 11-foot pole's price. "Why's it cost more than a 10-foot pole?" And then the real fun begins...

But without NPCs in the marketplace to interact with, that can get a little dull. That's where Insta-NPCs #10: Caveat Emptor comes in.

Caveat Emptor features include:

8 tables offering thousands of unique combinations of buyers and sellers in a marketplace setting
15 examples of NPCs created for fantasy, science fiction, and horror genres
2 revamped tables showing how to use the product as-is for science fiction as well as fantasy
1 worksheet for printing the whole process on a single page to use later
Nearly 6,000 words of material across 13 pages (10 pages of content)
All in a system-neutral, rules-neutral format for use with all your favorite games!


Caveat can be used for any setting or system. Need a market for a science fiction, fantasy, horror, or western adventure? I bet this will help!

boardgame.name: To Claw the Surface
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scratch For Sunlight. Gasp For Air.

The brave and the foolhardy flock to the dwarven village of Granitetop Mountain to make their fortunes escorting caravans and clearing mineshafts of monsters. When a cave-in pulls your adventurers into a massive fissure and strands them deep beneath the mountain’s surface with no obvious egress, they must use all of their wits and cunning to make it out alive. But survival is the only law in this deep and untamed wilderness, and adventurers are just as good as the next meal to the creatures that dwell in the darkness. Will the adventurers ever breathe the fresh air of the surface again—or will their lives be forfeit in these dangerous, maddening depths?

To Claw the Surface is an exciting adventure module in Jon Brazer Enterprises’ Deadly Delves series, and is compatible with the best-selling Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. This adventure is designed to challenge four to five 1st-level PCs like no other content has to date. Inside this 57-page volume, you’ll find:

11 new and modified monsters, 6 fully-statted NPCs, 11 new traps, and 2 new haunts for your Pathfinder campaign
11 full-color maps of the various passageways and forgotten structures buried deep under the mountain
20 new alchemical items, 3 new materials from which to make weapons and armor, 2 new pieces of equipment, a new intelligent item, and a new cursed item
Innovative encounters with the denizens of the deeps, including crazed derro, cruel duergar, hungry vermin, malformed giants, primeval dwarves, and vengeful haunts
Enough content to take your group of 1st-level PCs all the way to 4th level


Dangers Unknown. Treasures Untold. Adventure Awaits.

boardgame.name: Trick or Treat
boardgame.description:
Trick or Treat takes every kid's favorite part of Halloween and packs it into a fun filled, adventurous candy gathering card game. Which is perfect for those occasional rainy Halloweens, Halloween parties or those days when your family just wants to wear costumes.

Each player takes turns rolling dice to flip cards on the corresponding houses. Their goal is to become the big winner on the block who has collected the most candy, while trying to avoid a number of obstacles that make trick or treating an adventure.

boardgame.name: Partying Puppies
boardgame.description:
Partying Puppies is a lighthearted walk through a land of Puppyliciousness, with a dark zombie undercurrent that you are always trying to avoid. The object of the game is simple, be the last puppy standing as the other players fall to the zombie apocalypse; the last player not to be bitten by a zombie and get infected by the virus wins! It's that easy.

The twist of Partying Puppies is not only do you get to avoid getting bit by presenting an antidote card, or skip a turn, or the usual expected game mechanics but there are physical tasks to accomplish along the way. As a result, it's a combination card game, truth or dare, and charade mix. To progress a card may call on you to bark like a pup,fetch something, or force another player to do your ridiculous task.

boardgame.name: ILIOS
boardgame.description:
ATTACK RAID SURROUND

Troy circa 1200 BCE

Your destiny lies in your hands, as you stand before the ancient city of Troy, known to the ancient Greeks as Ilios. Attack, raid, surround and defend in campaigns between the Greeks and the Trojans found in Homer’s epic tale “The Iliad.”

In ILIOS: Battle for Troy, 2 to 4 players take turns deploying warrior tiles with white rays representing spears and swords and their directions of attack. When a player raids a warrior tile, they place a disk of their color to occupy it. Warrior tiles are occupied by different players throughout the game until a tile is completely surrounded. It is then removed from the board, and added to the plunder of the player occupying it. Multiple tiles may be surrounded on one play, and surrounded tiles may be occupied by other players. This means your opponents can plunder on your turn!

Troy Expansion

The climax of the battles of Troy was the capture of the fortified city of Troy, which was only taken with the Trojan horse. Capture Troy yourself with the aid of the horses and oracles.

ILIOS is an Ancient World Social Abstract Game SAG, designed for 2 players to 4 players. It calls for a blend of offensive and defensive strategies, with suspense introduced by the random draw of tiles.

To understand what you get, we uploaded a great range of photos on this BGG page. The Production Version is the standalone box set with cardboard tiles.

Deluxe ILIOS, with beautiful wooden tiles and a larger 8 x 8 board is now available as part of the Ancient World Multi Game System.

Treeker: The Lost Glasses is a first-person adventure game, with puzzle and platform elements. In the game, the player needs to use a pair of glasses in order to see mysterious objects left behind by some sort of ancient civilization.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Underdark Racial Feats is our latest Mythic Mini devoted to an assortment of playable PC races from the deep places below the earth, including drow, duergar, and svirfneblin! This product contains 13 marvelous mythic feats for deep-dwelling subterranean adventurers to strike out into the lighted lands above or to delve the dungeons below, from Drow Nobility and Spider Summoner to Giant Steps, Stoic Pose, and Umbral Scion!

Mythic Minis are short, inexpensive products designed to take one rules concept or set of Pathfinder RPG rules and bring them to you in a new way for the mythic rules, including converting existing rules as well as introducing entirely new rule options. Created by the same designers that helped bring you the official mythic rules, Mythic Minis skip the fluff and give you all crunch, all the time.

Nobody knows mythic like Legendary Games, and whether it's new mythic feats, class abilities, path abilities, magic items, or anything else, every Mythic Mini delivers a delicious dollop of dazzling design that will fill out your mythic experience one slice at a time. Check for a new Mythic Mini every Monday to make your game just a little more Legendary!

boardgame.name: 7 Summits: A Mountaineering Challenge
boardgame.description:
7 Summits: A Mountaineering Challenge is a game for one to four players in which players test their mountaineering skills against the highest mountain on each continent. First player to climb the seven mountains wins the game!

Choose which mountains you want to climb at your own pace and in any order that you want. There are ten different mountains from which to choose, each with unique statistics and rewards for successfully climbing them.

Use up to four gear pieces to prevent deadly accidents represented with a roll of the dice. Upgrade your acclimatization to prevent altitude sickness. Choose which climber cards you want to upgrade as you draw them to increase your movement speed on a mountain.

There are many risks for which you must prepare in this difficult challenge of climbing the highest mountain on each of the seven continents, and there are many people who want to climb them before you do. How will you attempt this deadly challenge?

boardgame.name: Orphanage of Fear
boardgame.description:
Orphanage of Fear is a social deduction game for six to seventeen players in the vein of Werewolf or Mafia. Players are either orphan children or sinister boogeymen. Hiding in plain sight the boogeymen wake each night to drag a child into their realm under the bed to fears upon their fear. During the day they hide themselves behind the masks of their previous victims.

The children have to find out who these monsters are, but they are not entirely alone. In desperation the children can take comfort with what toys the orphanage has, and may draw abilities from the toys themselves. They can shine the light of the magic projector to discover the true identity of the target, shield themselves during the night with their teddy bear, save themselves from the monster in the closet by feeding it their limberjack or hide under the blanket to shield them from all danger, but beware not all toys were placed there for the benefit of the children. The boogeymen can bring their own sackcloth doll to throw off the magic projector and make others perceive an innocent child as a boogeyman.

Unfortunately, the children can’t always rely on toys being there. The orphanage is short, even with many children now missing, and so every round the kindly, but out of his depth, caretaker sees to it that what toys are available are taken back and then given out at random.

Orphanage of Fear uses the traditional day night cycle of Werewolf. During the night the Boogeymen choose a child to drag into their realm of existence, along with the toy they are holding, to feed, and during the day the entire group debates and argues about who the impostors are before nominating a child or children. If only one child is nominated they can drag another child with them to the closet door. The player with the most votes is sent into the closet and gets eaten, along with their toy, by the monster inside. The game continues until either all the boogeymen are eaten by the closet monster at which point the children win or there are an equal amount of children and boogeymen at which point the boogeymen win.

boardgame.name: De Vampier van Havena
Der Vampir von Havena
The Vampire of Havena Solo Adventure
Il Vampiro di Havena
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb

You hear dull footsteps on the wet cobblestones, you hear the heavy boots that keep stepping into puddles. You can't see ten steps through the dense fog that wafts through the harbour district of Havena. Where exactly are your pursuers? How can you escape? With right and law you have never taken it as exactly as the priests of the Praio expect, but you have never had so much trouble. In any case, you can hardly rely on your eyes and even less on your hearing. Too many noises echo in the streets, the hissing of a cat, the flapping of the wings of a croaking raven - and the steps that seem to approach you from all directions at the same time ...

The Vampire of Havena is a solo adventure with which you can venture directly into adventure without a master or other player. Section by section you'll face new challenges as you read, and all your skills will be needed to get off safe and sound. You don't need any previous knowledge. A ready-to-play hero with whom you can embark on this adventure is included at the end of the volume, and all rules and game mechanics are explained directly in the book.
Off to adventure!

A solo adventure for a not so law-abiding hero.
Genre: Detective Story, Mystery
Prerequisites: none
Location: Havena
Time: any between 1038 BF and 1040 BF
complexity (player/master): low / -
Experience of the heroes: inexperienced to competent (with own heroes)
Requirements:
Craft 1/4
Body talents 2/4
Fight 1/4
Living History: 1/4


Klappentext

Du hörst dumpfe Schritte auf den nassen Pflastersteinen, hörst die schweren Stiefel, die immer wieder in Pfützen treten. Durch den dichten Nebel, der durch das Hafenviertel von Havena wabert, kannst du keine zehn Schritt weit sehen. Wo genau sind deine Verfolger? Wie kannst du entkommen? Mit Recht und Gesetz hast du es noch nie so genau genommen, wie es die Priester des Praios erwarten, aber so großen Ärger hattest du noch nie. Auf deine Augen kannst du dich jedenfalls kaum verlassen und auf dein Gehör noch viel weniger. Zu viele Geräusche hallen in den Straßen wieder, das Fauchen einer Katze, der Flügelschlag eines krächzenden Raben – und die Schritte, die sich dir aus allen Richtungen gleichzeitig zu nähern scheinen …

Der Vampir von Havena ist ein Solo-Abenteuer, mit dem du dich ohne Meister und Mitspieler direkt ins Abenteuer wagen kannst. Abschnitt für Abschnitt begegnest du beim Lesen neuen Herausforderungen, und all deine Fähigkeiten werden gefragt sein, um mit heiler Haut davonzukommen. Du benötigst keinerlei Vorkenntnisse. Ein spielfertiger Held, mit dem du dieses Abenteuer bestreiten kannst, ist am Ende des Bandes enthalten, und alle Regeln und Spielmechanismen werden direkt im Buch erklärt.
Auf ins Abenteuer!

Ein Solo-Abenteuer für einen nicht ganz so gesetzestreuen Helden.
Genre: Detektivgeschichte, Mystery
Voraussetzungen: keine
Ort: Havena
Zeit: beliebig zwischen 1038 BF und 1040 BF
Komplexität (Spieler/Meister): gering / –
Erfahrung der Helden: unerfahren bis kompetent (bei eigenen Helden)
Anforderungen:
Handwerk 1/4
Körpertalente 2/4
Kampf 1/4
Lebendige Geschichte: 1/4

Fall of the Tower is a momentous adventure for the Accursed game line. It represents a turning point in the struggle for the future of Morden, a savage blow struck against either the Witches who have conquered the land or the Order of the Penitent that seeks to save it.

boardgame.name: Termites
Termity
boardgame.description:
Termity is a strategy game about the grappling of indefatigable insects for 2 to 4 players.

At first glance, life goes slowly on the African plains scorched by the sun. Or so it seems. In the thicket of grass, termite swarms fight relentless battles. It is the territorial instinct that makes them contend perpetually. There is a tangible evidence for their fierceness - huge mounds which contain millions of insect warriors always ready to defend their fortress.

Prove your artifice and strategic thinking ability by fighting for survival with your opponents, conquering mounds and expanding into new territories.

The aim of the game is to take control over enemy and neutral mounds and defend your own nests. The player who has power over mounds with the biggest amount of points at the end of the game becomes the winner.

boardgame.name: Shadowrun: Crossfire Demo Box
boardgame.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Shadowrun: Crossfire - Demo Box is a trial version of the game that's perfect for learning the rules. We carefully picked out a subset of the full game that shows off Crossfire's feel and mechanisms in a small, elegant package. The demo box takes you through a shorter, tighter version of the "Caught in the Crossfire" mission included in the full game — it's the quickest way for new players to learn how to play.

Catalyst Game Labs is giving the Shadowrun: Crossfire - Demo Box to select gamers at Gen Con 2013 in mid-August.


The shadows of the Sixth World have every kind of danger you can imagine: ultra-violent gangers, flesh-eating ghouls, mages that summon spirits from toxic waste, backstabbing corporate raiders, hard-nosed police officers, and even dragons. You don't have much — mainly your guts, your wits, and your friends — but maybe that's enough. Between you and your teammates, you can sling spells, hack the Matrix, talk a tiger out of his stripes, and bring down a charging ork from a hundred yards away. Will that be enough to face down the worst the mean streets can throw at you? You're about to find out.

Shadowrun: Crossfire is a cooperative deck-building card game for two to four players set in the gritty, cyberpunk fantasy world of Shadowrun. Play a shadowrunner team and take on tough jobs such as protecting a client who's marked for death, shooting your way out of downtown when a run goes sour, or facing down a dragon. In each game you'll improve your deck with a mix of strategies, while earning Karma to give your character cyber upgrades, physical augmentations, magical initiations, weapons training and Edge.

Shadowrun: Crossfire - Demo Box includes two obstacle decks, a black market deck, a crossfire event deck, a mission sheet, 4 role cards, and 2 product information cards.

Differences from Shadowrun: Crossfire

- The crossfire card deck & obstacle decks are smaller than the full game

- The Demo box contains only 1 scenario (so the only way to play this version) and it is not included in the main Shadowrun: Crossfire game

- There are only four character cards (1 of which is the troll mage card which is not found in the base set, but was reprinted in Character Expansion Pack 1)

- The Demo box does not contain any tokens, and requires the players to use something of their own (coins etc.)

- The rulebook is shorter and does not contain all the rules listed in the base game, but contains information specific to the Demo box

boardgame.name: Space
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

BLAST INTO SPACE

This sourcebook for the What’s O.L.D. is N.E.W. roleplaying game system contains information on space and starship operations.

Astronomical information - scale, stars, spectral classifications, unusual stars, black holes, rogue planets, nebulae, anomalies, astroengineering.

Random space phenomena - from funnel clouds to quantum singularities; magnetars to wormholes.

Space travel - distance & time, setting assumptions, inner system travel, time dilation, types of FTL travel.

Starship combat - tactical (hex-based) and theatreof- the-mind space combat, Newtonian movement, two sample ships (the Murphy, and a Spartan Talon Class VI Scout).

Starship operations - ship classes and types, roles aboard a starship, using sensors, sickbays, tractor beams, transporters, and recreational facilities.

This book requires the use of a What’s O.L.D. is N.E.W. core rulebook.

Do I need this book? The information in this book is also found in its entirety in the N.E.W. roleplaying game core rulebook. If you have that book, you do not need to buy this one. If you have a different WOIN core rulebook and wish to add space elements to it, or if you are building your WOIN ruleset piecemeal, then this book will be useful.

boardgame.name: Bun Fight
boardgame.description:
The Glitterati of Bear Valley Hills are at an awards after-party, someone says the wrong thing, then the cakes start flying! Whoever comes out the other end cleanest is the winner.

Bun Fight is a board game in which players move between tables laden with various cakes to grab and hurl at their rivals.

On their turn, a player has a number of actions enabling them to move to a table, grab a cake, push a cake in someone's face (close combat), or hurl it at someone (ranged). "Sweet Surprise" cards may be played at any time by any player, adding effects or helping players avoid/recover from trouble. Cakes (Just Desserts) cause Splat and Stun, and the player with the fewest Splat when the last cake is grabbed wins. Stun causes a player to miss actions but can be avoided by either dropping a cake or discarding Sweet Surprise cards if preferred.

boardgame.name: Masamune
boardgame.description:
On behalf of the faculty and staff of Masamune Shining Forge Academy, it is with great pleasure that we inform you of your admission to Masamune. You were selected from an incredibly competitive and capable group of applicants, and showed an intense devotion to creating weapons worthy of legend.

Masamune is a game for two to four players, and takes place over the course of an academic year at Masamune Shining Forge Academy. As a pupil at Masamune Shining Forge Academy, you and your opponents will start the game with identical 12-card decks. Over the course of the game, you will forge sentient weapons called Chibis and teach them powerful special techniques to defend the Academy from attacking monsters. Alternatively, you can use Chibis to gain more powerful cards and bolster your deck.

Just like normal schools, Masamune Shining Forge Academy uses Exams to measure its pupils’ academic growth. Every time a new card is added to your deck, there is a chance that the next card drawn from the Academy deck will be an Exam, an intense battle staged by your instructors that lures the monsters teeming in the surrounding forest to attack the Academy! After the fifth and final Exam is completed, the school year is over, and the pupil who harvested the most monsters has won the game!

boardgame.name: Atlantean Temple
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 48 inch by 30 inch, Battlemap of an Atlantean Temple , with Hex, Square and No overlay and comes with a Savage Worlds Adventure and a 360 view of the inside of the Temple.

The PDF includes includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“There are too few Atlanteans left to keep the island floating. Drastic measures must be taken.”—High Priestess Teefa

Atlantean Temple is an interior map of a temple and the exterior surroundings. This product includes a 360-degree panoramic view from the west center interior of the temple. This is a land based temple set in an era prior to the fall of Atlantis.

Atlantean Temple is intended for use in fantasy games.

This location is useful as a temple of worship for a god or goddess. It is also useful as a place devoted to arcane magical rituals without devotion to particular gods and deities.

The included Savage Tale, A Chance at Power, has Savage World NPC statblocks made with the Savage Worlds Core Rules by Pinnacle Entertainment Group and a page of NPC stat cards. A Chance at Power is intended for use in fantasy Savage Worlds games.

Even if not using Savage Worlds, the map and panoramic view are generic and system neutral. The NPC descriptions and savage tale can be adapted to many fantasy settings featuring gods and goddesses while ignoring or adapting the Savage Worlds stat blocks.

Adventure hook for this map:

A Chance at Power: As the power of Atlantis wanes, a desperate high priestess sends messengers from the island to foreign lands attempting to lure them to the island with the promise of extended life and more magical power than they ever dreamed of possessing. And if that fails, wealth. One of these invitations makes it into the hands of the player characters, especially if the group has magicians who have gathered some renown in their adventures. The messenger awaits their decision. If yes, he guides them to a boat that will take them to the legendary island of Atlantis…

boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

FIVE SCENARIOS FOR BEGINNING KEEPERS

Doors to Darkness provides five scenarios written especially for beginning Keepers and players of Call of Cthulhu. Here you will find horror, mystery, investigation, ghastly monsters, strange magics, and forgotten secrets, as well as plenty of advice about how to run the adventures for best effect.

As well as the scenarios, an essay by Kevin Ross details a wide range of hints and tips on running Call of Cthulhu – guidance any Keeper, new or experienced, will find very useful.

The Darkness Beneath the Hill – A friend's house renovation project leads to unexpected discoveries in Providence, Rhode Island.

Genius Loci – Not all is well at Danvers State Lunatic Asylum and it's down to the investigators to heed a friend in need's cry.

Servants of the Lake – The hunt for a missing person reveals ancient secrets in the wilds north of Kingsport.

Ties That Bind – Strange rock formations have been found in Mrs. Carrington's prized fountain. But these are like no rocks seen before!

None More Black – The death of a Miskatonic University student leads the investigators into unsavoury neighbourhoods and dark business dealings.

Also included are ten diverse and ready-to-play investigators, allowing players to dive straight into the mysteries contained within Doors to Darkness. Lastly, just because these scenarios are written with new players in mind, don't expect them to be a walk in the park! Those who dare to open the doors to darkness will discover just what secrets and dangers lie within!

boardgame.name: Landed
boardgame.description:
The year is 008 Post Galactic Colonization. Humans have developed the technology to terraform planets, and it has become a very lucrative business. Terraforming companies now race to newly discovered planets to mold them in the most profitable way possible. They will stop at nothing to satisfy their wealthy investors.

Landed is a competitive tile-laying game where players take control of rival terraforming companies that have simultaneously reached the same newly-discovered planet. All players will sign unique contracts with investors to terraform this new world and claim use of the land. The player who fulfills the most valuable contracts and scores the most points is the winner.

In this 2-4 player, hex tile laying game, you begin the game with 2 contracts and 4 double sided tiles. On your turn, you may complete one of the following actions:

1. Play a tile from your hand, adjacent to any other tile. You may fulfill a contract. Obtain a satellite card if you place a satellite tile next to another satellite tile.
2. Draw tiles until you have a hand of 4.
3. Draw 3 contracts. Choose 1 or 2 to keep and discard the remaining ones. You may have at most 3 unfulfilled contracts at a time.

You may also optionally play 1 satellite card as a free action at any time during your turn.

Play continues clockwise. When the last tile is drawn, the last round begins, with the player who drew the last tile getting the last turn. The player with the most points is the winner.

boardgame.name: The Sealed Ark
boardgame.description:
The Sealed Ark is a co-operative game which can be played solo or all the way up to 5 people.

Before you roll the die, you must gather a single focus then roll the die to see where will the spirit appear i.e.
(rolls a 4, a single spirit will appear at that 4th circle.)

Players now have the choice of moving to another circle, perform an ability, banish a spirit or do nothing and keep the focus. If the player rolls a 6 on the die, a spirit will appear at the center of the ark (the void) and a spirit card will be drawn and read out loud and do what it's told.

To win, players must carefully plan out their strategies with each unique spirit of harmony and gather enough focus to seal all 5 circles before the void reaches a total of 9 spirits.

boardgame.name: Horse & Musket: Dawn of an Era
boardgame.description:
Horse and Musket: Dawn of an Era is a simple tactical game system that covers the development of musket warfare from Vienna in 1683 and Sedgemoor in 1685 to Appomattox in 1865. Volume I will cover warfare in the west from 1683-1720, when the bayonet replaced the pike.

The battles included are...

Vienna - September 12, 1683 – “We came, we saw, and God Conquered.”

Sedgemoor - July 6, 1685 – The Bloody Assizes

Killiecrankie - July 27, 1689 – Slaughter at Sundown

Fleurus - July 1, 1690 – The French Cannae

Aughrim - July 22, 1691 – Bloody Hollow

La Prairie - August 11, 1691 – Double Ambush

Neerwinden - July 29, 1693 – Le Tapissier de Nôtre Dame

Marsaglia - October 4, 1693 – The Massed Bayonet Charge is Born

Narva - November 30, 1700 – Charles XII Smashes the Russian Army

Chiari - September 1, 1701 – Catinat’s Last Battle

Klissow - July 19, 1702 – Charles XII Invades Poland

Blenheim - August 13, 1704 – “A Famous Victory”

Fraustadt - February 13, 1706 – The Swedish Cannae

Turin - September 7, 1706 – Eugene’s Greatest Victory

Almansa - April 25, 1707 – Battle of the Exiles

Poltava - July 8, 1709 – The Student Surpasses the Master

Malplaquet - September 11, 1709 – Mort et convoi de l'invincible Malbrough

boardgame.name: Total Transmogrification
boardgame.description:
Take on the role of mighty shape shifters. By using powerful attacks and assuming the form of mighty beasts the shifters do battle to see who will reign supreme. The first player to empty their hand is the winner of the duel and can lay claim to the title of the Ultimate Shape Shifter.

Play

Select a Form - Each player selects one Form Card from their stack of face down Form Cards and places in the center of the table but in front of them.

Select a Combat Style - Each player then selects one of their combat style cards from their hand and places it face down besides their form card.

Reveal - All cards are flipped face up.

Resolution: The success of a combat style depends on the form.
If successful, players put the Combat Style Card face down in the discard pile.
If unsuccessful, players put the combat style card back in their hand.

End of turn - Players put the Form Card they just used aside, face-up and return any previously used Form Cards back to their stack.

Winning

The game ends when a player ends a turn with no Combat Style Cards in their hand.

Note

This contains all three Transmogrification Games; Transmogrification, Advance Transmogrification and Epic Transmogrification.

boardgame.name: The Endless Land
boardgame.description:
The Endless Land is a game with modular boards that are placed in a different way each game for a new experience each time! Some players will choose dangerous quests and heroic battles to gain victory. Some will set up commerce and trade routes to conquer the land. There is magic and adventure among the dwarves, elves, and humans that live in this realm. Make sure you have plenty of food for the journey and let the quest begin!

On a turn all players will take their actions simultaneously. They travel to a neighboring town (move their player meeple on the board) and collect the goods which have been accumulating there. The board is modular and matches up with other board parts to form a unique terrain each game. Also, the game expands with more 8" X 10" board pieces to form a playing surface as with no knowable end. Each player uses gold, wheat, wood, iron, and many other commodities to build farms, stores, and implements of combat.
Players may also take quests that send them into the lairs of diabolical monsters who are hoarding gold, rubies, and other valuable items. Players can risk sneaking into the dark caverns and taking the loot, but if the monster awakens they are in trouble.
Players can build strongholds so that even when they are not in a town, that town is building up their store of goods.

Players can trade each turn to turn their wheat, sheep, or cattle into food, they can also trade other commodities for food in a town where that is in demand.

Players can travel faster buy buying a horse or boat.

Players wishing to build or buy must have food to stay in a particular place longer to transact business.

Points are gained by building structures and conquering creatures. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

boardgame.name: Commanders: Tactical Strategy Game
boardgame.description:
Dice-based combat with tile-based resource gathering. Spend resources to expand your armies, upgrade soldiers, or climb the tech tree.

The goal of the game is to capture 20 enemy soldiers. The first player to do this wins. However, if all of one player's soldiers have been captured (they have no more on the board or in their reserve pile), then the player who has the highest number of enemy soldiers captured wins.

The board is made up of hexagon-shaped tiles set up in a large hexagon shape. These tiles consist of six different kinds of resource tiles as well as a base tile in the middle of the board and at each of the six corners.

As players move soldiers from tile to tile, they leave behind Possession Markers to claim those tiles as part of their territory.

If you expand too far away from a base tile, another player could move in behind you, separating your territory from a base tile and capturing your soldiers.

Each turn you may collect one resource card for each soldier you have on the board - corresponding with the resource tiles they occupy.

On your turn, you can trade resource cards with other players regardless of whether or not they are your ally. Your resource cards can be spent on a wide variety of items to help you win.

boardgame.name: Defenders of Knife Edge Pass
boardgame.description:
A horde of terrible creatures are on the rampage in the East. The defenceless trading village of Hilt (located just to the west of Knife Edge pass) has called for heroes to help defend Hilt and the entire western lands from the oncoming horde. Choose between 1 and 3 heroes to defend the pass, defeat the oncoming horde and claim VICTORY! ... plus Hilt is super rich and has many beautiful, eligible, young men and women!

Construct the Pass using between 3 and 5 double sided cards, construct the Horde deck based upon a chosen scenario and choose between 1 and 3 heroes. Each turn a new monster enters the pass. You will need to upgrade your heroes and use all your skills in order to stop the advancing horde.

Beware! If a single monster makes it through the pass or all your heroes die then you lose.

boardgame.name: Stockopolis
boardgame.description:
User summary

The action revolves around a twenty-four card chance deck and a pair of six-sided dice, three numbers of each die are green and the other three are red.

Each player begins the game with $40,000. After the deck of cards is shuffled and placed face down on the superfluous game board, the top card is drawn and read aloud to establish the conditions of trades for that player. That player follows the direction on the card. The dice are rolled and the results are enacted based on the chart on the card.

After twenty four turns, the deck is depleted and the Power Play round begins. Each person, in turn, chooses one last trade and rolls the dice and check the card for each individual result.

The final round of play has each player roll the dice one last time to determine if each player must pay a trading fee.

Now, the game is over and the player with the greatest net worth is the winner.
